questions.text: Which of the following is not seen in both schizophrenia and depression?
questions.solution:
• Formal thought disorder is seen only in schizophrenia.
  • Remaining all three options can be seen in both.

choices.text: Patient A: My wife is cheating on me
Patient B: I am the most powerful person in the world
Patient C: Neighbors are talking about me
Patient D: My brain is controlled by a microchip

questions.text: Four patients are talking about the content of their thoughts. Which of the following is considered as a bizarre delusion?
questions.solution:
• Bizarre delusion: scientifically impossible and culturally implausible
  • Nonbizarre delusion: False, but possible

questions.text: A patient is not able to express his emotions normally after road traffic accident. There can be injury in which of the following anatomical structure?
questions.solution:
Limbic system: MATCH

  • Limbic system: Generates the emotion
  • Frontal Lobe: Regulates the emotion

questions.text: A patient was started on a TCA drug (amitriptyline) and was found to be unconscious. Which of the following is not suggestive of TCA toxicity?
A 40 year old man on carbamazepine has developed psychotic symptoms. Which of the following drugs should not be given to this patient?
questions.solution:
• Clozapine and carbamazepine have grave side effect “AGRANULOCYTOSIS”.
  • Both should not be combined, as there can be superimposition of agranulocytosis

questions.text: A 19 year old boy is presented with complains of hearing some voices and aggressive behavior for last 48 hours. He had fever before these symptoms. Family members are reporting that he is muttering to himself and it seems that he is talking to someone. There is no history of any psychiatric illness before. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
• As per duration (less than 1 month), it is a case of Acute psychosis.
  • Acute psychosis is preceded by any stressor like fever.
  • And there is no altered sensorium, so delirium is not the answer.

questions.text: A pregnant female (3rd trimester), who is a known case of bipolar disorder with previous history of 4 episodes, visited a psychiatrist. She didn't get any episode for last 1 year and well controlled on Lithium 750mg. What is the next step in the management?
Which of the following side effects is less commonly seen with carbamazepine than oxcarbazepine?

A 35 year old female presents with low mood, loss of hope, sleep disturbances, least concentration, lack of energy, feeling of worthlessness for last 4 weeks. Which of the following drugs is the first to be given?
questions.solution:
• This is a case of depression.
  • SSRI is the DOC.

questions.text: A bipolar patient on mood stabilizer has developed hyperammonemia and raised hepatic enzymes. Which of the following drugs is likely to cause these symptoms?
questions.solution:
• Serious adverse effects of VALPROATE:
  • Liver toxicity: Increased Transaminase
  • Pancreatitis
  • Ammonia increased
  • Teratogenic
  • Thrombocytopenia

questions.text: Which of the following is not seen in conversion disorders?
questions.solution:
• Jealousy is not a neurological sign.
  • Remaining others are.

questions.text: After abusing a substance, a person is presented with red eyes, feeling of derealization, floating in air and increased appetite. Most likely he has abused;
questions.solution:
Marijuana (cannabis) intake symptoms:

  • It is ch. by euphoria, reddening of conjunctiva, sense of slowing of time, sense of floating in air, increased appetite and dryness of mouth.
  • Other symptoms are: depersonalization, derealization and synesthesia (crossing over of sensory perception, i.e. patient will say he is hearing light and seeing the music)

questions.text: A 30 year old male presented to hospital with altered sensorium and pinpoint pupil. Which substance intoxication is suspected in this case?
questions.solution:
Overdose:

  • Slow respiration, hypothermia, hypotension, bradycardia, pin point pupils, cyanosis and coma.

questions.text: A 45 year old male presented to OPD with complaints of mild chest pain. O/E, patient has some extra beats in pulse. Doctor has confirmed that it is benign and there is no need of any intervention. But patient is worried that this could be a serious cardiac problem. So he is going for repeated investigations and consulting many doctors for the same. This is a type of;
questions.solution:
• Hypochondriasis: Preoccupation with as serious illness on the basis of misinterpretation of a benign symptom.
  • Consulting many doctors inspite of reassurance.

questions.text: A 53 year old male, a chronic alcoholic tried to stop taking alcohol after several requests by his family members. After quitting, he started feeling uneasy, nauseating and headache. He is brought to hospital on day 3 when he started having cloudiness of consciousness, visual hallucination and insomnia. During the examination, he was shaking and having profuse sweating. He was agitated and abusing the people around. Which of the following is appropriate line of management for this patient?

A chronic alcoholic person who was using 1 bottle of whiskey daily, stopped consuming the alcohol for last 2 days. Lab investigation shows deranged LFT and normal KFT. Which of the following drugs should be used for detoxification?
questions.solution: Treatment:

questions.text:
Consider the following statements;
1. Precontemplation: A person who smokes, is considering to quit smoking.
2. Contemplation: A person is considering to start morning walks because of its benefits to the health
3. Maintenance phase: A person has quit smoking for one year and has not smoked since then
4. Action phase: A person with obesity says he can't do anything as it ruins deep in his family.
questions.solution:
Psychosocial treatment for Substance use disorder: Stages of motivation (Prochaska Declemente)

  • Acc. to Trans theoretical model of change, following stages of change are there;
  • Precontemplation
  • Contemplation
  • Preparation/Decision
  • Action
  • Maintenance
  • Recovery/Relapse

questions.text: During mental status examination, a patient is asked to repeat the numbers at the gap of 5 (5 - 10 - 15 - 20 - 25_____). This test is better for assessment of which of the following higher mental function?

choices.text: In coherence and flight of ideas

questions.text: A patient with paranoid schizophrenia talks about "cyana-pi" but he is not able to explain it and reach a conclusion. He often uses old words in a different fashion, like "Time vessel for wrist watch". His condition can be referred as;
A patient on antipsychotics x 3 weeks, presented with high fever, body pain, raised CPK and myoglobinuria. Which medicine can be more beneficial for the patient?
questions.solution:
• Diagnosis is Neuroleptic malignant Syndrome.
  • Side effect of antipsychotic drugs (esp. Typical)
  • DOC: Dantrolene

questions.text: Waxy flexibility is seen in which psychiatric patient?
Agitation, miserable feeling, somatization, intense feeling of guilt are the hallmark symptoms of;

choices.text: Leave him as normal adolescent problem
Rule out oppositional defiant disorder/conduct disorder

questions.text: A 19 year old student complaints of lack of interest in studies for last 6 months. He is not interested in attending marriage functions. He has frequent quarrels with his parents and has frequent headaches. Which of the following is the most appropriate clinical approach for this patient?
questions.solution: • In adolescent and children, depression frequently presents with irritability, lack of interest and changes in behaviour like withdrawn or quarrelsome.

questions.text: A 23 year old man comes to psychiatry OPD with complains of irritability, guilt of not being able to perform well in office and decreased interest in recreational activities since he left college 3 years back. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25 year old female is presented to OPD with complaints of agitation, muttering to herself and sleep disturbances. She claims that her husband has stolen the baby from her womb. She has delivered a healthy child three weeks back, however has not taking care of the baby. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
BREXANOLONE

  • FDA approved 2019, I/V infusion (60 hours continuous I/V infusion)
  • First ever drug to be approved specifically for treatment of POSTPARTUM DEPRESSION.

Zurzuvae - Oral

questions.text: A 40 year old male has the fear of leaving home, travelling alone and being in a crowd. He often develops palpitation and sweating in these situations. He avoids public transportation to go to his work place. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
AGORAPHOBIA

As per DSM - 5, Fear or anxiety for ≥2 of the following situations:

  • 1. Being in open spaces
  • 2. Being in enclosed places
  • 3. Being in crowded places
  • 4. Being outside of the home alone
  • 5. Using public transportations

It usually coexist with panic disorder.

Treatment: SSRI, BZD + CBT - ERT (SD)

questions.text: A 21-year-old woman is attending the clinic for the first time. She is currently repeating her university examinations for the third consecutive year. She reports being unable to attend lectures and seminars because she feels 'anxious' while attending them. She dreads being asked a question in front of the group as she is concerned that she will say something stupid. She has been unable to make friends as she avoids conversation out of fear that she will have to talk to more than one person. She constantly worries about others judging her when in conversation and as a result avoids mixing with people as much as she can. She finds relief from her anxiety symptoms when at home. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
SOCIAL PHOBIA (SOCIAL ANXIETY DISORDER)

  • Intense, persistent fear of being watched or judged by others.
  • Fear of embarrassment in social situation.
  • Comorbidity: other anxiety disorders, depression ( alcoholism.
  • Treatment: SSRI, BSD
  • CBT: Exposure therapy

choices.text: Can't develop after 6 months of accident

questions.text: Which of the following is not associated with PTSD?

choices.text: Exposure therapy and response prevention can be supportive

questions.text: A young boy feels that dirt has hung onto him whenever he passes through the dirty street. He knows that there is actually no such thing after he has cleaned once but he is not satisfied and compelled to think so. Although he knows that this is completely irrational but he can't control his thoughts. It gives him anxiety and depressive mood. Which of the following is wrong about his condition?
Severe visual hallucinations are commonly seen in;

A 70 year old male patient is brought to OPD clinic with one year illness characterized by marked forgetfulness, personality changes, poor self care, visual hallucinations, suspiciousness and progressive deterioration in his condition. His MMSE score is 21. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An adult patient is presented to hospital after RTA. O/E, he appears to be disoriented. In his condition, Mini Mental Examination is done to assess;
questions.solution:
MMSE -to assess cognitive functions

  • MMSE assesses the following five cognitive functions and gives them different weightage.
  1. Orientation - 10 points
  2. Registration - 3 points
  3. Attention and concentration - 5 points
  4. Recall - 3 points
  5. Language - 9 points
  • Max score = 30
  • ≤24/30 = indicative of cognitive impairment

questions.text: A 34-year-old man is referred to the out-patient clinic, reporting ongoing difficulties with his landlord. He has been in several arguments with him and says that his landlord is to blame for these. He admits that he drinks late into the night, but denies his landlord's accusations that he is playing loud music and shouting. He has several arrests for assaults and has been violent to previous girlfriends, with whom he has only had short-term relationships. He does not understand why his last girlfriend was upset when he hit her. What type of personality disorder does this man have?

An 18-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with superficial, self-inflicted cuts to her arms. She said that she did this to relieve tension, as she has been feeling very low in mood and does not have hope for the future. However, her mother says that earlier in the day she seemed to be in a good mood and was laughing with her in the kitchen. When they later argued, she became very angry and began to scream at her mother, saying that no one loved her. She has a very unstable relationship with her boyfriend and she is preoccupied with her weight and uncertain about her sexuality. What is the most likely diagnosis here?

choices.text: New classification is based on severity of symptoms as mild, moderate and severe
Patient wants to get treated as soon as possible
Type A people are very competitive in nature

questions.text: Which of the following is wrong about personality disorders?

A 21 year old female is presented to OPD with complaints of nutritional deficiencies and weight loss. She avoids eating food as she doesn't like the smell of food. On further evaluation, it is found that she is not image conscious. She is suffering from:

Which of the following is a wrong match?
1. SCOFF: Eating Disorder
2. M-CHAT: ADHD
3. CAGE: Alcohol
4. AUDIT: Cannabis

choices.text: Weight for height less than 75% of normal

questions.text: Hospitalized management of anorexia nervosa is done on priority in patients with;
questions.solution: • Weight for height less than 80% of expected is an indication for admission.

questions.text: EEG pattern shown below is seen during which phase of sleep cycle?
questions.solution: EEG patterns in sleep

questions.text: Which of the following drugs should not be given in a case of insomnia?
questions.solution: • Modafinil is a stimulant drug.

questions.text: Which test is a better option to differentiate psychogenic and organic cause of erectile dysfunction?
Which phase is shortest in sex cycle?

A 3 year old girl is brought to OPD with features of handwringing stereotyped movements, impaired language and communication development, breath holding spells, poor social skills and deceleration of head after six months of age. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following drugs is recently approved for an autistic spectrum disorder where MECP2 gene is affected?

choices.text: Can follow simple verbal commands and handle money

questions.text: A child with IQ 50, which of the following is true?
questions.solution:
• 50 - 69: Mild MR
  • Mild MR people can have an independent living, handle money, study till 6th class

questions.text: A 4 year old girl is sexually attracted towards her father. This can be seen in which age of children?
questions.solution: PSYCHOSEXUAL STAGES OF DEVELOPMENT

questions.text: Father slapped elder son. Then elder son slapped his younger sister. After that, younger sister broke the mirror. Which type of defense mechanism is this?
Along a pleasant stimulus, anoxius stimuli is given in treatment of alcohol dependence and paraphilias. This is an example for which kind of behavior therapy?
Identify the cognitive distortion, where a person picks single negative event and ignores all the positive things;
